docs.lead_paragraph: McDonald's Corp's U.S. restaurants will gradually stop buying chicken raised with antibiotics vital to fighting human infections, the most aggressive step by a major food company to change chicken producers' practices in the fight against dangerous 'superbugs.'

headline.main: McDonald's USA to Phase Out Human Antibiotics From Chicken Supply
headline.print_headline: McDonald's USA to Phase Out Human Antibiotics From Chicken Supply

docs.snippet: McDonald's Corp's U.S. restaurants will gradually stop buying chicken raised with antibiotics vital to fighting human infections, the most aggressive step by a major food company to change chicken producers' practices in the fight against dangerous...

docs.lead_paragraph: McDonald's says it plans to require chicken suppliers to stop using antibiotics important to human medicine within two years.

headline.main: McDonald's Chicken Gets New Standard: No Human Antibiotics
headline.print_headline: McDonald's Chicken Gets New Standard: No Human Antibiotics

docs.snippet: McDonald's says it plans to require chicken suppliers to stop using antibiotics important to human medicine within two years.

docs.lead_paragraph: There are serious consequences to limiting the drugs you can receive.

headline.main: Are You Really Allergic to Antibiotics?
headline.print_headline: Are You Really Allergic to Antibiotics?

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Dr Victoria Dooley warns of widespread consequences of people mistakenly claiming or believing that they are allergic to certain antibiotics, particularly with rise of antibiotic-resistant bacteria.
docs.snippet: There are serious consequences to limiting the drugs you can receive.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mark Bertolini, the chief executive of Aetna, is betting that bringing yoga, meditation and higher wages to his employees will be good business.

headline.main: At Aetna, a C.E.O.’s Management by Mantra

docs.abstract: Profile of Aetna chief executive Mark Bertolini, who has attempted to reshape insurer's corporate culture by offering free yoga and meditation classes to workers, while also increasing its minimum wage.
docs.snippet: Mark Bertolini, the chief executive of Aetna, is betting that bringing yoga, meditation and higher wages to his employees will be good business.
